page.title: 02BUILTH WELLS,POWYS CONT.
page.content:
During the Nineteenth Century,the town
became renowned for its spa at Park Wells which produced exceptionally strong saline water. During the period of popularity enjoyed by its mineral waters,Builth's population expanded and many large town villas were built mostly using local stone quarried at Llanelwedd. The great Welsh Prince, Llewelyn,is thought to have died at the hands of English soldiers nearby and a stone obelisk has been erected to his memory at Cilmeri. Very little remains of Builth's Norman castle except a large moated mound. Builth has a thriving Arts Centre at Wyeside which incorporates a theatre, cinema,exhibition gallery,workshops and a restaurant.
